intro: Nastus amazonicus, commonly known as the Amazonian nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and pungent, peppery scent, similar to that of watercress. Its leaves are edible and often used in local cuisines for their sharp, spicy flavor. Nastus amazonicus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in humid, tropical environments.
